intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale yellow with four petals. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and more compact growth habit compared to other subspecies of Biscutella laevigata.
